title: Is there a difference in the amount of salt that can be dissolved in hot water than in cold water? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q. Is there a difference in the amount of salt that can be dissolved in hot water than in cold water? A. Yes there is. But at what temperature do you mean by “hot" water? See the graph. At 0 °C, ~35 g/L of NaCl will dissolve vs 40 g/L at 100 °C.  Therefore a 5 g/L difference exists between 0 °C and 100 °C. 🎃😎
No there is no difference in the amount but salt dissolves more quickly in hot water. As another fun fact, hot water freezes more quickly than room temperature water.
